name: Paris
clues: Home to a famous tower finished in 1889
Called the City of Light
funFacts: The Louvre is the world's largest art museum.
Famous for café culture and haute cuisine.

name: Tokyo
clues: Capital city with over 13 million residents
Known for high-tech, anime, and cherry blossoms
funFacts: It's the most populous metropolitan area in the world.
Tsukiji once was the world's largest fish market.

name: Rome
clues: City built on seven hills
Home to ancient gladiatorial arenas
funFacts: Contains a country within its borders.
People throw about €1.5 million into its famous fountain annually.

name: New York City
clues: Known as the Big Apple
Has a famous statue gifted by France
funFacts: More than 800 languages are spoken here, making it the most linguistically diverse city in the world.
The subway system has 472 stations.

name: Cairo
clues: City near three famous triangular structures
Located on the banks of the Nile
funFacts: It's the largest city in Africa.
The Khan el-Khalili bazaar has been operating since the 14th century.

name: Sydney
clues: Home to a famous opera house with sail-like roofs
Largest city in Australia
funFacts: The Sydney Harbour Bridge is nicknamed 'The Coathanger'.
Bondi Beach is one of the most famous beaches in the world.

name: Rio de Janeiro
clues: Has a 98-foot statue of Christ overlooking the city
Famous for its annual carnival
funFacts: Its name means 'January River' in Portuguese.
Copacabana Beach stretches for 4.5 kilometers.

name: Venice
clues: City built on more than 100 small islands
Known for canals instead of streets
funFacts: There are over 400 bridges in this city.
The entire city is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Barcelona
clues: Famous for Gaudí's unfinished cathedral
Capital of Catalonia
funFacts: La Sagrada Familia has been under construction since 1882.
The city has 9 UNESCO World Heritage Sites.

name: London
clues: Home to a famous clock tower often mistakenly called by the bell's name
City where the Underground was the world's first subway system
funFacts: The London Eye is the world's tallest cantilevered observation wheel.
It has more than 170 museums, many of which are free to visit.

name: Amsterdam
clues: City with more bicycles than people
Known for its elaborate canal system
funFacts: Has over 1,500 bridges crossing its canals.
Many houses tilt forward intentionally to avoid furniture damage when moving.

name: Istanbul
clues: Only city in the world located on two continents
Previously known as Constantinople
funFacts: The Grand Bazaar is one of the world's oldest and largest covered markets.
Tulips originated in Turkey, not the Netherlands.

name: Dubai
clues: Home to the world's tallest building
City with man-made islands shaped like a palm tree
funFacts: Has the world's only 7-star hotel, the Burj Al Arab.
Less than 15% of residents are native Emiratis.

name: Kyoto
clues: Former imperial capital of Japan for over 1,000 years
Known for its numerous temples and gardens
funFacts: Has over 1,600 Buddhist temples and 400 Shinto shrines.
Was spared from atomic bombing in WWII due to its cultural significance.

name: San Francisco
clues: City with a famous fog-shrouded bridge
Known for its steep hills and cable cars
funFacts: The Golden Gate Bridge is painted 'International Orange' to enhance visibility in fog.
Alcatraz Island was a federal prison for 29 years.

name: Machu Picchu
clues: Ancient city built high in the Andes mountains
Rediscovered in 1911 by Hiram Bingham
funFacts: It was built around 1450 and abandoned just over 100 years later.
The stonework is so precise that you cannot fit a knife blade between the stones.

name: Prague
clues: City of a hundred spires
Has a medieval astronomical clock that still works
funFacts: Prague Castle is the largest ancient castle complex in the world.
The city was largely undamaged by WWII, preserving its historic architecture.

name: Bangkok
clues: City with the longest official name in the world
Known for floating markets and street food
funFacts: The full ceremonial name of Bangkok is 168 letters long.
It's home to over 400 ornate Buddhist temples.

name: Jerusalem
clues: Holy city to three major religions
Contains the Western Wall
funFacts: It has been destroyed and rebuilt at least twice.
The Old City has four quarters: Jewish, Christian, Muslim, and Armenian.

name: Marrakech
clues: Known as the Red City due to its buildings
Famous for its labyrinthine medina
funFacts: Jemaa el-Fnaa square transforms into a huge open-air restaurant every night.
The medina contains over 3,000 twisting alleyways.

name: Athens
clues: Birthplace of democracy
Home to ruins of a famous hilltop temple complex
funFacts: It's one of the oldest cities in the world, with a recorded history spanning over 3,400 years.
The Acropolis was built in the 5th century BCE.

name: Cape Town
clues: City near the meeting point of two oceans
Overlooked by a flat-topped mountain
funFacts: Table Mountain has over 2,200 species of plants, more than the entire United Kingdom.
It's home to the world's largest individually timed cycle race.

name: Petra
clues: Ancient city carved into rose-colored stone
Featured in 'Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade'
funFacts: It was unknown to the Western world until 1812.
The Treasury building is actually a royal tomb.

name: Santorini
clues: Island with iconic blue-domed churches
Built on the rim of an active volcano
funFacts: Its official name is Thira.
The island is what remains after one of the largest volcanic eruptions in history.

name: Mexico City
clues: Built on the ruins of an ancient Aztec city
Highest elevation major city in North America
funFacts: It's slowly sinking because it was built on a lake.
Has the most museums of any city in the world.

name: Berlin
clues: City once divided by a famous wall
Has a gate topped with a quadriga statue
funFacts: Has more bridges than Venice.
The TV Tower is visible from every district of the city.

name: Moscow
clues: City with colorful onion-domed cathedral in Red Square
Home to the world's largest country's government
funFacts: The Moscow Metro is known for its ornate stations decorated with chandeliers and artwork.
The Kremlin is the largest active fortress in Europe.

name: Hong Kong
clues: Known for its stunning skyline and harbor
Former British colony returned to China in 1997
funFacts: Has more skyscrapers than any other city in the world.
The Star Ferry has been in operation since 1888.

name: Angkor Wat
clues: Largest religious monument in the world
Ancient temple complex in Cambodia
funFacts: It appears on the Cambodian flag.
It was originally built as a Hindu temple, later converted to Buddhism.

name: Vienna
clues: City of music, home to Mozart and Beethoven
Known for coffee houses and Sachertorte
funFacts: It's the only capital city with its own wine region.
The Spanish Riding School has been training Lipizzaner horses for over 450 years.

name: Buenos Aires
clues: South American city known as the 'Paris of the South'
Birthplace of tango
funFacts: Has the widest avenue in the world, 9 de Julio Avenue.
El Ateneo Grand Splendid is a bookstore in a former theater.

name: Reykjavik
clues: World's northernmost capital city
Heated by geothermal energy
funFacts: Almost all of Iceland's heating and electricity comes from renewable sources.
The name means 'Smoky Bay' due to steam from hot springs.

name: Seoul
clues: Capital city with ancient palaces and modern skyscrapers
Divided by the Han River
funFacts: The Seoul subway is among the world's most extensive and heavily used.
Songdo, near Seoul, is a completely planned 'smart city'.

name: Havana
clues: City known for vintage cars and colorful colonial buildings
Capital where Hemingway wrote 'The Old Man and the Sea'
funFacts: The Capitol building is slightly taller than its counterpart in Washington, DC.
Has one of the largest collections of colonial architecture in the Americas.

name: Florence
clues: Birthplace of the Renaissance
City where Michelangelo's David is displayed
funFacts: The Uffizi Gallery houses the world's finest collection of Renaissance art.
The Florence Cathedral dome was the largest in the world until 1881.

name: Taj Mahal
clues: Marble mausoleum built by a Mughal emperor for his wife
Located in Agra, India
funFacts: It took more than 20,000 workers and 1,000 elephants to build.
The marble changes color throughout the day.

name: Toronto
clues: City with a tower featuring a glass floor
Most populous city in Canada
funFacts: Over 180 languages and dialects are spoken there.
Has the longest street in the world, Yonge Street.

name: Great Barrier Reef
clues: World's largest coral reef system
Visible from space
funFacts: It's made up of over 2,900 individual reefs and 900 islands.
It's home to more than 1,500 species of fish.

name: Bora Bora
clues: Island known for overwater bungalows
Has a dormant volcano at its center
funFacts: The island is only 6 miles long and 2.5 miles wide.
It was discovered by Captain James Cook in 1769.

name: Serengeti
clues: Home to the great wildebeest migration
Name means 'endless plains' in Maasai
funFacts: The migration involves over 1.5 million wildebeest.
It's one of the oldest ecosystems on Earth, with vegetation and climate barely changed in the past million years.

name: Maldives
clues: Nation of coral islands with the lowest elevation on Earth
Known for underwater restaurants and hotels
funFacts: It consists of 1,192 coral islands grouped into 26 atolls.
The highest natural point is just 2.4 meters above sea level.

name: Easter Island
clues: Remote island with nearly 1,000 stone statues
One of the most isolated inhabited islands
funFacts: The statues (moai) average 13 feet tall and weigh 14 tons.
The indigenous name for the island is Rapa Nui.

name: Mont Saint-Michel
clues: Medieval monastery on a tidal island
Connected to mainland France by a causeway
funFacts: The tides can rise up to 46 feet.
It has been a strategic fortress since ancient times.

name: Dubrovnik
clues: Walled city on the Adriatic Sea
Filming location for 'Game of Thrones'
funFacts: The city walls are 1.9 miles long and up to 25 meters high.
It was an independent republic for centuries, known as Ragusa.

name: Chichen Itza
clues: Mayan pyramid that casts a serpent shadow during equinoxes
Archaeological site in the Yucatan Peninsula
funFacts: The main pyramid has 365 steps, one for each day of the year.
It has the largest ball court in ancient Mesoamerica.

name: Bali
clues: Island known as the 'Island of the Gods'
Famous for terraced rice fields
funFacts: It has over 20,000 temples.
The Balinese calendar has 210 days in a year.

name: Denali
clues: Highest mountain peak in North America
Located in Alaska
funFacts: It rises 18,000 feet from base to summit, one of the largest base-to-peak rises in the world.
The mountain creates its own weather system.

name: Sahara Desert
clues: World's largest hot desert
Covers much of North Africa
funFacts: It's approximately the size of the United States.
Some areas can go years without rainfall.

name: Kathmandu
clues: Capital city in the Himalayas
Known for ancient temples and stupas
funFacts: Durbar Square contains more than 50 temples.
The city was founded in the 12th century.

name: Galapagos Islands
clues: Archipelago where Darwin developed his theory of evolution
Home to unique species like giant tortoises
funFacts: These islands are located at the confluence of three ocean currents.
They're home to the only penguin species found north of the equator.

name: Cappadocia
clues: Region known for unique rock formations and cave dwellings
Famous for hot air balloon rides at sunrise
funFacts: Underground cities there could shelter up to 20,000 people.
The rock formations are called 'fairy chimneys'.

name: Niagara Falls
clues: Three waterfalls straddling an international border
Known for its massive water volume
funFacts: It's not the tallest waterfall, but has the highest flow rate.
The falls erode about 1 foot per year.

name: Mount Everest
clues: Earth's highest mountain above sea level
Known as Sagarmatha in Nepal and Chomolungma in Tibet
funFacts: It grows about 4mm taller every year.
The first confirmed summit was in 1953 by Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay.

name: Pompeii
clues: Ancient Roman city preserved by volcanic ash
Destroyed by Mount Vesuvius in 79 CE
funFacts: The city was rediscovered in 1748.
Archaeologists found loaves of bread that were still intact.

name: Madagascar
clues: Island nation where 90% of wildlife is found nowhere else
Home to lemurs and baobab trees
funFacts: It's the world's fourth-largest island.
It separated from India approximately 88 million years ago.

name: Kyiv
clues: City with golden-domed monasteries
One of the oldest cities in Eastern Europe
funFacts: The city is built upon seven hills, like Rome.
Its metro station Arsenalna is the deepest in the world at 105.5 meters.

name: Cusco
clues: Ancient capital of the Inca Empire
Gateway city to Machu Picchu
funFacts: The city was designed in the shape of a puma.
Many buildings have Inca foundations that have survived numerous earthquakes.

name: Antelope Canyon
clues: Slot canyon with swirling sandstone walls
Created by flash flooding over millions of years
funFacts: The Navajo name means 'the place where water runs through rocks'.
The light beams that shine down into the canyon only occur at certain times of day and year.

name: Victoria Falls
clues: Waterfall known locally as 'The Smoke That Thunders'
Located on the border of Zambia and Zimbabwe
funFacts: It's the largest sheet of falling water in the world.
During the full moon, a 'moonbow' can be seen at night.

name: Varanasi
clues: One of the world's oldest continuously inhabited cities
Holy city on the banks of the Ganges River
funFacts: It's considered the spiritual capital of India.
There are over 2,000 temples in the city.

name: Dead Sea
clues: Hypersaline lake where people float effortlessly
Earth's lowest land elevation
funFacts: It's about 10 times saltier than the ocean.
The water level is dropping by about 3 feet per year.

name: Yellowstone
clues: Home to Old Faithful geyser
World's first national park
funFacts: It sits on top of a supervolcano.
Contains more than half of the world's geysers.

name: Lisbon
clues: City built on seven hills with yellow trams
Rebuilt after a devastating 1755 earthquake
funFacts: It's the oldest city in Western Europe, predating Rome by centuries.
The Vasco da Gama Bridge is the longest bridge in Europe.

name: La Paz
clues: Highest administrative capital in the world
City with a cable car public transportation system
funFacts: The city's elevation ranges from 3,100 to 4,100 meters above sea level.
It has a 'Witches' Market' selling unusual items like dried frogs and llama fetuses.

name: Grand Canyon
clues: Mile-deep gorge carved by the Colorado River
Reveals nearly two billion years of Earth's geological history
funFacts: It's 277 miles long and up to 18 miles wide.
Contains some of the oldest exposed rock on Earth.

name: Pamukkale
clues: Natural site with terraces of mineral-rich thermal waters
Known as 'Cotton Castle' in Turkish
funFacts: The ancient city of Hierapolis was built on top of it.
The white travertine terraces are formed by calcium deposits from the hot springs.

name: Aurora Borealis
clues: Natural light display in high-latitude regions
Also known as the Northern Lights
funFacts: They're caused by collisions between electrically charged particles from the sun and atmospheric gases.
The different colors are produced by different types of gas particles.

name: Mumbai
clues: City formerly known as Bombay
Home to the Gateway of India monument
funFacts: It's the world's most densely populated city.
Dharavi is one of Asia's largest slums but also a major economic hub.

name: Petra
clues: Ancient city carved into rose-colored stone
Featured in 'Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade'
funFacts: It was unknown to the Western world until 1812.
The name comes from the Greek word for 'rock'.

name: Antarctic Peninsula
clues: Northernmost part of the Antarctic mainland
Most visited region of the seventh continent
funFacts: It's one of the fastest-warming places on Earth.
Home to millions of breeding Adélie and gentoo penguins.

name: Uluru
clues: Massive sandstone monolith in the Australian Outback
Sacred to indigenous Australians
funFacts: It changes color throughout the day, appearing to glow red at sunset.
The rock extends 2.5 km underground.

name: Fiji
clues: Archipelago of more than 330 islands
Known for blue lagoons and coral reefs
funFacts: Only about a third of the islands are inhabited.
It was a British colony until 1970.

name: Moai of Easter Island
clues: Monolithic human figures carved from rock
Created by the Rapa Nui people
funFacts: There are nearly 1,000 statues, averaging 13 feet tall and weighing 14 tons.
Many were toppled during tribal conflicts.

name: Chernobyl
clues: Site of a 1986 nuclear disaster
Now a ghost town in northern Ukraine
funFacts: Wildlife has flourished in the absence of humans.
The area won't be safe for human habitation for up to 20,000 years.

name: Amazon Rainforest
clues: World's largest tropical rainforest
Produces 20% of Earth's oxygen
funFacts: It contains one in ten known species on Earth.
The forest is estimated to contain 390 billion individual trees.

name: Amalfi Coast
clues: Stretch of coastline with colorful cliffside villages
UNESCO World Heritage Site in southern Italy
funFacts: The road along the coast has over 1,000 curves.
It was once a powerful maritime republic.
